The advanced satellite aims to provide high-speed cellular broadband to smartphones worldwide.

description: Gujarat has removed nearly 74 lakh names from its electoral rolls, reducing the total voter count from 5.08 crore to 4.34 crore. This extensive clean-up, part of the Special Intensive Revision exercise, targeted deceased, absent, and duplicate voters. The updated draft rolls are now public, with a deadline of January 18 for objections and claims.

School paradox: Govt enrolment dominates even as thousands of classrooms empty
description: India’s government schools still educate most children, but the system is increasingly mis-sized. In 2024–25, over 65,000 government schools reported zero or near-zero enrolment, even as teacher postings stayed intact. In several states, private schools now enrol more students than government schools. The data points to misalignment, not collapse—enrolment shifts faster than consolidation and redeployment.

title: Taiwan: 2 killed in smoke grenade, knife attacks at Taipei metro stations
description: At least eight people were injured in Taipei's metro system following smoke grenade and knife attacks. Three individuals suffered cardiac arrest, with one suspect also in critical condition after falling from a building. Investigations are ongoing into the motive behind the incident, prompting increased security measures across Taiwan.

description: Tamil Nadu's draft electoral roll after the SIR has 5.43 crore voters. The SIR exercise removed over 97 lakh names. The exercise, opposed by chief minister MK Stalin, aimed to ensure accuracy but drew criticism for potentially deleting legitimate voters. Similar revisions are under way in West Bengal, which lakhs of voters were deleted.

title: Vaping, woof & shouting match: Viral moments from Parliament Winter Session - watch
description: The Lok Sabha's 19-day Winter Session concluded with a productivity of 111 percent, marked by the passage of key bills like the Viksit Bharat–Guarantee for Rozgar and Ajeevika Mission (Gramin) Bill. The session witnessed heated debates, protests, and viral moments, including accusations of vaping, a Congress MP bringing a puppy, and unruly scenes during bill passages.

title: Indian Railways unreserved ticket booking online: What passengers must carry during train travel
3 Mumbai wards to have low water pressure during Christmas week
Why Trump reclassifying cannabis is major milestone in legalisation push
Amid talks of alliance with Ajit Pawar for PMC polls, NCP(SP) workers voice mixed opinion
Weeks after abandoning Pakistan tour, SL sacks Asalanka from captaincy
description: "Shanaka's role will be of an all-rounder. When I stopped being a selector, Shanaka was the captain. Charith (Asalanka) was in our long term plans then," Wickramasingha said.

title: Congress sacked Odisha leader: Why it should not ignore his message
Condemn face covering but Nitish Kumar pulling a woman’s hijab was deplorable: Banu Mushtaq

Based on science, ensures wellbeing of mother, child: Gauhati High Court junks challenge to ART provision prescribing age limit
GOAT Tour: Messi's visit shows India loves football icons — just not Indian Football
description: Lionel Messi’s India tour exposed a stark paradox: Indians passionately celebrate global football icons but neglect their own game. While crores were spent on celebrity appearances, Indian football leagues struggle for survival, sponsors, and audiences. The frenzy highlighted misplaced priorities, where social media clout outweighs sustaining domestic football, leaving Indian players, clubs, and the sport itself at a crossroads.

6 workers killed, 9 injured as water tank bursts at Avaada’s plant in Nagpur
Singapore Police finds ‘no foul play’ in Zubeen Garg death case
Tristan Jarry injury update: Oilers goalie exits after getting hurt
description: Edmonton Oilers goaltender Tristan Jarry left the game against the Boston Bruins after a slide across the crease appeared to injure his lower body. Backup goaltender Calvin Pickard took over in the net. Head coach Kris Knoblauch confirmed that Jarry’s condition will be reviewed by medical staff, with the severity of the injury still unclear.

title: 8 Indian-origin people among 20 held as Canadian authorities bust major automobile theft network
‘Important to keep putting pressure on yourself to get ready for World Cup’: Varun Chakaravarthy

Cyber fraudsters threaten 82-year-old woman in Mumbai with arrest over video call, swindle Rs 5 lakh
India's delayed $5-trillion dream: What IMF’s new timeline means for your wallet; impact on EMI, taxes
description: India's $5 trillion economy target has been pushed to 2028-29, primarily due to currency depreciation and lower-than-expected nominal GDP growth. While the real economy continues to grow, this delay impacts imported goods, foreign education costs, and potentially government finances, urging a focus on long-term financial planning over political timelines.

GM at 13, India's Raunak still struggles to have full-time coach — Exclusive
description: Raunak Sadhwani became a chess Grandmaster in 2019 at just 13, among India’s youngest to do so. Now 19 and ranked eighth among juniors, he reflects on the high cost of professional chess. Despite lacking a full-time coach, Raunak is competing at the top level as he prepares for the upcoming World Rapid and Blitz Championships.

title: India vs South Africa 5th T20I, Live Cricket Score: IND beat SA by 30 runs, win series 3-1
Decoding Noam Chomsky's friendship with Jeffrey Epstein
description: This is not a story about crimes. There is no evidence linking Noam Chomsky to Jeffrey Epstein’s sexual offences. That boundary should not be blurred. But this is very much a story about power, judgement, and proximity. About how elite worlds function. About how influence circulates. And about how even those who devote their lives to critiquing systems of domination can misread them when they arrive dressed as conversation.

title: Travis Kelce sparks childhood nostalgia with reveal of original Pokémon cards
description: In a New Heights podcast promo, Travis Kelce excitedly opened a Pokémon Gold Pack, sparking a playful debate with his brother Jason about their childhood fandom. Travis's childlike wonder and humorous comment about a "Medicham" card having a "BBL" had fans in stitches, with many requesting the segment return weekly.

title: Karnataka HC temporarily halts felling of 371 trees at Bengaluru Cantonment railway compound
Barack Obama shares his list of favourite movies, songs: Sinners, One Battle After Another, BLACKPINK’s Jump find mention

'Might appoint Pandya': Gill not to be vice-captain for T20 WC?
description: Aakash Chopra believes Shubman Gill will likely continue as vice-captain for the T20 World Cup 2026, despite recent form concerns. However, he acknowledges that the team management might keep the position open or consider Hardik Pandya. Chopra also revealed his India squad, highlighting Abhishek Sharma and Varun Chakaravarthy as potential top performers.

'No agreement': Sidda rejects power-sharing theory; K'taka CM row intensifies
description: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah has dismissed claims of a two-and-a-half-year power-sharing arrangement within the state government. He asserted that he will remain CM until the party high command decides otherwise, refuting opposition questions about a potential leadership change. Deputy CM D.K. Shivakumar also denied rumors of a dinner meeting, emphasizing party unity.

title: HC upholds benefits for Punjab FCI officer acquitted in 20-year-old bribery case, points to ‘honourable acquittal’

This is what could happen when you wear new clothes without washing them
UP Assembly drama: BJP and SP face off over cough syrup racket — with some props
Over half NCERT posts vacant as zero hiring for 2 years, Parl data shows crisis
description: Parliamentary data from the Ministry of Education has revealed that over half of the sanctioned posts at NCERT and its constituent bodies remain vacant. With no recruitment carried out for two consecutive years, staffing shortages are most severe in Group B and Group C posts. The organisation has increasingly relied on contractual staff to manage operations. Similar patterns of negligible permanent recruitment were also reported at NCTE and NIOS.

title: ‘I didn’t really expect to go’: Josh Inglis opens up about playing IPL 2026 for LSG after getting Rs 8.6 crore deal at auction
Winter Session ends: Decoding 19 days of chaos; key bills passed, debates missed
description: The Lok Sabha's Winter Session concluded after 19 days, marked by disruptions and sharp political clashes. Despite passing eight key bills, including those on insurance FDI and nuclear energy, crucial debates on air pollution and electoral reforms were overshadowed. The session ended with both Houses adjourned sine die, leaving significant issues unresolved.

title: Student needed blood to survive, it gave her HIV: How gaps in transfusion safety are affecting young thalassaemia patients
WATCH | Priyanka Gandhi, other opposition leaders join PM Modi, Om Birla over tea
Avatar Fire and Ash movie review: James Cameron builds his world on a familiar template
Hindu man lynched in B'desh: Yunus govt firefights; vows to punish perpetrators
description: Bangladesh's interim government condemned the lynching of a Hindu man and widespread violence following the assassination of poll contender Sharif Osman bin Hadi. Urging citizens to resist mob violence, the Yunus-led government vowed perpetrators would not be spared, emphasising the upcoming elections as a national commitment and supporting targeted journalists.

Pune’s Christmas tree market sees warm blend of tradition, modernity and rising demand for sustainability
Viksit Bharat Shiksha Adhishthan Bill: New institutional architecture of higher education
description: India’s higher education system has expanded fast, but regulation has stayed cluttered and uneven. This column explains how the Viksit Bharat Shiksha Adhishthan Bill, 2025 tries to fix that by creating one apex body and three linked councils for regulation, accreditation, and standards, with outcomes and public transparency at the centre. The promise is graded autonomy with accountability.

Bharti Singh, Haarsh Limbachiyaa welcome second son after medical emergency

Ex-gym trainer kicks toddler playing badminton on Bengaluru road
description: A incident unfolded in Thyagarajanagar, South Bengaluru, where a 35-year-old gym trainer allegedly kicked a five-year-old boy playing badminton. The unprovoked assault, captured on CCTV, left the child with injuries. Police have registered a case under the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita, with the accused reportedly undergoing psychiatric treatment.

title: Bangladesh unrest: Hindu man lynched, body tied to tree and set on fire
description: A Hindu man was beaten to death and his body set ablaze in Bangladesh's Mymensingh district following blasphemy allegations. This incident occurred amidst broader unrest, including attacks on media institutions and protests following the death of a student leader, raising concerns over minority safety and press freedom.

title: Nadella Issues AI Ultimatum: CEO demands full commitment from top brass
description: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella is demanding executives fully embrace the company's AI transformation or face departure.  He views AI as both a critical opportunity and a potential threat, personally engaging leaders to ensure commitment.  This aggressive push involves significant organizational shifts and a renewed focus on technical innovation to prevent obsolescence.

title: SC upholds man's will cutting off daughter for marrying 'outsider'
Bret Hart & Stephanie Washington net worth 2025: Wrestling legacy and assets
description: Bret Hart, known as "The Hitman," has amassed a net worth of $7 million through his successful wrestling career with WCW and WWE, merchandise, and royalties. He married his third wife, Stephanie, in 2010, and their joint assets include their Alberta home. Despite a significant age gap, Stephanie has supported Hart through his health challenges.

title: Live-in relationships not illegal, says Allahabad HC; grants police protection to 12 couples
description: The Allahabad High Court ruled that live-in relationships are not illegal, granting protection to 12 couples facing threats. Justice Vivek Kumar Singh emphasized that adults in such relationships are entitled to life and liberty, directing police to provide immediate security after verifying age and voluntary cohabitation.

title: Meta AI’s highest-paid employee unhappy; calls management 'suffocating'
description: Meta's $14.8 billion investment in Scale AI and the integration of its CEO, Alexandr Wang, into a new "superintelligence" lab are reportedly facing internal friction. Wang allegedly finds Mark Zuckerberg's micromanagement "suffocating," while some staff question Wang's experience. This shift also clashes with Meta's open-source AI philosophy, leading to executive departures.

title: Quote of the day by Leo Tolstoy: 'I often think men don’t understand…'
description: Leo Tolstoy, a globally acclaimed author and philosopher, explored and evaluated profound themes of personal transformation and societal hypocrisy in his works. His timeless quotes, like "Everyone thinks of changing the world, but no one thinks of changing himself," emphasize the importance of inner change.

title: Inside Josh Allen’s luxury car collection: Bills QB’s impressive garage
description: Buffalo Bills quarterback Josh Allen's impressive car collection showcases his journey from humble beginnings to NFL stardom. His garage features a mix of rugged trucks like the Ford F-150 Raptor and luxury SUVs such as the Jeep Grand Wagoneer and Range Rover Sport, reflecting his need for utility and comfort in Buffalo's climate.

title: Warner Bros-Netflix deal: WBD wants Oracle founder’s backing
description: Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD) has rejected Paramount Skydance's $108 billion hostile takeover bid, deeming it "misleading" and "inadequate." WBD's board urged shareholders to reject the offer, citing financial concerns and a lack of a strong personal guarantee from Larry Ellison. The company reiterated its preference for a merger agreement with Netflix, which it considers superior and more transparent.
